Package com.mindstar.common.utility.math

Class ModuloCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindstar.common.utility.math.ModuloCounter
  • public class ModuloCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    A counter that restarts at the beginning after reaching the upper limit.

    ModuloCounter(int, int) is initialized with 2 integers: the number to start counting from (threshold), and the number we count to (ceiling). For instance, say we wanted to count from 0 to 25, we initialize the counter thus: ModuloCounter counter = new ModuloCounter(0,25). Calling reset() would set the counter to 0. Calling increment() would increment the counter by 1. Once the counter reaches 25, calling increment() would wrap it around right back to 0.

      • moveToCircular

        public void moveToCircular​(int desiredNumber)
        If desired position is out of range, counter will wrap around. For example: if threshold = 2, ceiling = 7, and desiredNumber = 10, counter will move to 5 (threshold + 3).
        Parameters:
        desiredNumber - number to fast forward counter to
